sentences.english: There was a click as the hunter cocked his rifle .
sentences.chinese: 咔嗒一聲，獵人扳動了槍機。

sentences.english: The soldier clicked his heels and saluted.
sentences.chinese: 那個兵兩腳跟咔嗒一聲，立正敬禮。

sentences.english: Another train was rattling across the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 另一列火車咔嗒咔嗒地穿過了那座橋。

sentences.english: Another train was rattling across the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 另一列火車咔嗒咔嗒地穿過了那座橋。

sentences.english: The door opened with a click.
The monotonous rhythm of wheels clicking on the trails soon lulls you to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 車輪碾過路軌發出的單調“咔嗒”聲，很快催人入睡。

sentences.english: The cart clattered over the cobble-stones.
sentences.chinese: 馬車咔嗒咔嗒響着經過大卵石路。

sentences.english: The cart clattered over the cobble-stones.
sentences.chinese: 馬車咔嗒咔嗒響着經過大卵石路。

sentences.english: Marsha heard the lock click softly.
sentences.chinese: 瑪莎聽到鎖輕輕地發出咔嗒一聲。

sentences.english: Don't clatter your knives and forks.
She is sending text messages with unerring skill, the keys are being tapped.
sentences.chinese: 她嫺熟地發着短信，把手機按鍵按得不住地咔嗒響。

sentences.english: The guard clicked the door when the prisoner went into the jar.
sentences.chinese: 那位犯人一走進監獄，看守咔嗒一聲把門關上了。

sentences.english: The key clicked in the lock.
sentences.chinese: 鑰匙在鎖裏“咔嗒”響了一聲。

definition: (onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
(onom.) breaking or snapping/(coll.) cut it out/stop it/also written 喀嚓[ka1 cha1]
